sect2.title: Categories Module
sect2.subtitle: Categorized data utility. Admin->Categories.
sect2.para: In this section, we discuss the configuration and operation of the Categories module.

listitem.para: Name: The name of the category that is displayed to users.
Description: A description of the category that is displayed to users.
In relation to this category: Select an existing category from the drop-down list. This existing category serves as the reference point for the Position function, below.
Position: It is possible to make sub-sub-categories (etc). Select a category / sub-category from the "In relation to this category" drop-down list above, then select the Position below.

Right before, in the same level: If you want the new/edited category to be placed ABOVE the category specified in "In relation to this category" and be on the same level (for example, if the category selected in "In relation to this category" is a top-level category, this new/edited category will also be top-level), select this option.

Right after, in the same level: If you want the new/edited category to be placed BELOW the category specified in "In relation to this category" and be on the same level (for example, if the category selected in "In relation to this category" is a top-level category, this new/edited category will also be top-level), select this option.

The first child category: If you want the new/edited category to be placed ABOVE the category specified in "In relation to this category" and to be a child category of the category referenced in "In relation to this category", select this option.

The last child category: If you want the new/edited category to be placed BELOW the category specified in "In relation to this category" and to be a child category of the category referenced in "In relation to this category", select this option.

Optional image: From this drop-down list, select the image associated with this category. The image format can be any popular image file format (JPG, GIF, PNG, etc) and must exist in one of two directories:
or
<xarroot>/themes/[theme name]/modules/categories/images for theme-dependent versions
Click "Add" to add category.
Create in a batch:
Click "Reassign".
Add Category:
Category list:
Name: The name of the category.
Description: The description of the category.
Image: The optional image associated with the category. See Optional image, above, for information on the location for the image file.
Options: Using these options, you can modify or delete categories.
Modify: Click the Modify link on the line of the category you wish to modify. On the next panel, you can edit the Name, Description, Position, and Image for the selected category.
Delete: Click the Delete link on the line of the category you wish to delete. On the next panel, you are asked to confirm your intention by clicking "Yes" to delete.
Categories per page: Click "Reload" to reload page with new value for this field.
This panel allows modification of configuration options for this module.

Default number of categories per page: In this field, enter the number of categories to be displayed per page in the administration panel. For example, to display up to 100 categories, enter "100" in this field.

Windows Explorer like tree? (requires JavaScript enabled browser): If you have a JavaScript-enabled browser and would like to display collapsible menu tress, set this field to YES. The default setting, NO, does not rely on JavaScript.
Click "Submit" to save changes.

sect3.title: EXAMPLE: Adding sub-sub-categories (etc.) to a Category
sect3.para: Xaraya allows the site administrator to make categories with sub-sub-categories and sub-sub-categories (etc.), as shown below. In this example, we'll make a category with two sub-categories, and two sub-sub-categories. There are extra categories in the diagram below; create them on your own if you wish.
sect3.literallayout: Animals of all sorts (top-level category) | |---Dogs (sub-category) | | | |---Jack Russell Terriers (sub-sub-category) | | | |---Greyhounds (sub-sub-category) | |---Cats (sub-category) | | | |---Domestic Long Hair (sub-sub-category) | | | |---Domestic Short Hair (sub-sub-category) | |---etc...
sect3.para: Create a main category called "Animals". Create a sub-category of Animals called "Dogs" and another called "Cats". Create two sub-sub-categories of Animals, in Dogs, called "Jack Russell Terriers" and "Greyhounds". Here's how to do it...

listitem.para: Add Animals category. Admin->Categories->Add Category. Enter main category with the following parameters:
Name: Animals
Description: "Animals of all sorts!"
In relation to this category: Select "Categories" from the drop-down list.
Position: Select "Right after, in the same level" from the drop-down list.
Click "Add" to save category.
Add Dogs sub-category. Admin->Categories->Add Category. Enter main category with the following parameters:
Name: Dogs
Description: "All about dogs!"
In relation to this category: Select "Animals" from the drop-down list.
Position: Select "The first child category" from the drop-down list.
Click "Add" to save category.
Add Cats sub-category. Admin->Categories->Add Category. Enter main category with the following parameters:
Name: Cats
Description: "Felines!"
In relation to this category: Select "Animals / Dogs" from the drop-down list.
Position: Select "Right after, in the same level" from the drop-down list.
Click "Add" to save category.
Add the Jack Russell Terriers sub-sub-category. Admin->Categories->Add Category. Enter the main category with the following parameters:
Name: Jack Russell Terriers
Description: "Terriers!"
In relation to this category: Select "Animals / Dogs" from the drop-down list.
Position: Select "The first child category" from the drop-down list.
Click "Add" to save category.
Add the Greyhounds sub-sub-category. Admin->Categories->Add Category. Enter the main category with the following parameters:
Name: Greyhounds
Description: "Greyhounds category"
In relation to this category: Select "Animals / Dogs / Jack Russell Terrier" from the drop-down list.
Position: Select "Right after, in the same level" from the drop-down list.
Click "Add" to save category.
